title: Montgomery man charged with murder in teen's death
content:
A Montgomery man has been arrested for fatally shooting a teenager who allegedly stole the man's vehicle on Sunday, Montgomery Police said.
Desman DeAngelo Webster, 31, was charged with capital murder on Monday and is being held without bond in the Montgomery County Detention Facility. The shooting occurred in the 3000 block of Woodley Road, where Lt. Regina Duckett said a vehicle was stolen.
Officers found the teen's body while responding to a reported recovery of a stolen vehicle Sunday night in the 2300 block of East South Boulevard. The body was found near the stolen car, Duckett said.
During the investigation, it was discovered that the teen was a suspect in the vehicle theft. Webster, the owner of the vehicle, was identified as the suspect of the shooting. Officers are not identifying the shooting victim because the teen was a juvenile suspect in a felony.
No more information was released about the shooting as of Monday afternoon.
